summary: An FBI email from August 14, 2019, in which an FBI Special Agent in Charge relays information from John Penza that Jeffrey Epstein's private aircraft is located in Brunswick, Georgia for maintenance. The agent indicates the FBI likely has no immediate need to locate or search the plane but is passing the information along.

persons.name: John Penza
persons.role: Contact providing information to the FBI
persons.context: He reached out to the FBI to inform them that Jeffrey Epstein's plane was in Brunswick, Georgia for maintenance, suggesting the FBI might want to locate or search it.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: His private aircraft is the subject of the email; its location in Georgia is reported to the FBI.

connections.description: Penza provides information about the location of Epstein's aircraft to the FBI, indicating he has a contact with knowledge of the plane.

events.title: Epstein's Aircraft Location Reported to FBI
events.description: John Penza contacts the FBI to report that Jeffrey Epstein's private plane is in Brunswick, Georgia for maintenance, suggesting the FBI might want to locate or search it.

keyFacts: On August 14, 2019, John Penza informed the FBI that Jeffrey Epstein's private aircraft was in Brunswick, Georgia for maintenance.
The FBI agent receiving the information indicated the Bureau likely had no immediate need to locate or search the aircraft at that time.
The email shows external parties were providing tips about Epstein's assets (his plane) to the FBI during the investigation.
